content: christmas star decoration designed by alice jones ©alice jones 2023 1 christmas star decoration this pattern is easier than it looks the star is made in two halves on single-pointed needles then the halves are sewn together around the edges with some filling in between instructions for knitting in the round are not included here but the pattern is simple enough to be converted easily to this method the stars shown in the photos here were made with ritz yarn - 97% acrylic 3% lurex this is now discontinued but similar chunky/bulky weight yarns are readily available several stars can be quickly made to grace your christmas tree or to hang up in windows they also make great handbag charms -o0o- materials approximately 3g/0 1oz of chunky/bulky acrylic yarn with or without a sparkly thread of lurex running through it this equates to a yardage of approximately 14m/15 yards or 1372cm/540in 1 pair 4 5mm single-pointed needles small amount of polyester filling wool needle for sewing up measurements approximate 9cm/3 5in diameter excluding hanging loop gauge not important for this pattern instructions cast on 5 sts leaving a 7 5cm/3in yarn tail 1st row kfb to end 10 sts 2nd row *p 1 pfb repeat from * to end 15 sts 3rd row *k 2 kfb repeat from * to end 20 sts 4th row *p 3 pfb repeat from * to end 25 sts 5th row *k 4 kfb repeat from * to end 30 sts 6th row *p 5 pfb repeat from * to end 35 sts 7th row k 2 decrease k 3 k 2 decrease tbl turn 8th row p 5 turn 9th row k 2 decrease k 1 k 2 decrease tbl turn 10th row p 3 turn 2 11th row sl 1 k 2 decrease pass first st over and drop off needle break yarn leaving a 7 5cm/3in tail and pass through final st to fasten this completes the first point of the star rejoin yarn at start of rem sts on left-hand needle leaving a 7 5cm/3in tail repeat 7th-11th row then break yarn and pass through final st as before work three more points on rem sts leaving a longer yarn tail 17 5cm/7in at the tip of the first of these three points the longer tail will form the hanging loop make another piece the same making up using yarn tail at cast-on edge of first piece gather this edge and pull tight then fasten_off to close centre of star sew row ends together joining first and last points from centre to 6th row repeat with second piece place both pieces together with wrong purl sides facing and row end seams on top of each other using some short yarn tails but leaving longest tail free sew two pieces together around edges of four points from 7th to 11th row darn in any remaining yarn tails except for longest one stuff star lightly
